page.title: 10KING'S OAK EQUESTRIAN CENTRE
page.content: King's Oak occupies about 20 acres of which 12 acres are fields, where the horse live during the day in summer. There are 65 horses including liveries.13 people are employed to tend, groom, clean and train.Students training for exams work at the school in exchange for lessons.Horses are bought from Horse Sales or Dealers, some for resale, others to be ridden in the school.Lessons cost Â£5.50 an hour for children and Â£6.50 for adults.Private lessons are more expen- sive.The school opens daily.There is both an indoor and outdoor school, stables, a feedroom where prepared food and cereals are kept in bins, next to which is the forge, where the blacksmith uses a gas fired furnace. Next comes the tack room where the 65 saddles and bridles are kept.
